org.chemicalmozart.model.implementations.reactionrules

Class RythmeHRR

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chemicalmozart.model.implementations.reactionrules.RythmeHRR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReactionRule

    public class RythmeHRR
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReactionRule
    This ReactionRule is used to generate the harmonic part of a measure.
    Starting from a DegreeImpl, it generates a ChordImpl.
    A ChordImpl is quite similar to a DegreeImpl but it also contains the notion of duration.
    Here is how it works, it takes the following reagents.
    • Subsolution : (the order must be respected for the tests)
      • BarInCreation : An object that identify the current bar in creation
      • int : Which is the current number of ChordImpl in the subsolution
      • DegreeImpl : The current DegreeImpl
      • QuaterLeft : The number of quaters still free for the new ChordImpl


    It puts back in the subsolution :
    • a int
    • ChordImpl
    • QuaterLeft
    • BarInCreation

      • computeResult

        public java.lang.Object[] computeResult()
        The computeResult must choose a duration for the ChordImpl that we are going to generate. It must be a random choice between 2 or 4 quaters. It must take in consideration the elapsed time in QuaterLeft. Once the duration is chosen, it creates a ChordImpl based on the current DegreeImpl. The position of the DegreeImpl must be set correctly (value of the int before it has been incremented).
        Specified by:
        computeResult in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        The new ChordImpl well initialized @see ChordImpl, the int increased by one, the QuaterLeft decreased by the duration.

      • computeSelect

        public boolean computeSelect()
        Must check that the BarInCreation object is in the good state and that all objects are present.
        Specified by:
        computeSelect in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        true if the present reagents are compatible with the reaction.

      • getMultiplicity

        public ReactionRule.Multiplicity getMultiplicity()
        Description copied from interface: ReactionRule
        This method must return the multiplicity of the reaction. Two of them exist:

        ONE_SHOT indicates that the reaction will happen only once, the ReactionRule will then be removed from the solution.

        INFINITY_SHOT indicates that the reaction will always happen if reagents are present, until solution inertia. Contrary to OneShot, the ReactionRule will not be removed from the solution after reaction.

        Specified by:
        getMultiplicity in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        the multiplicity of the reaction (ONE_SHOT or INFINITY_SHOT).
